content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function with derivative given by <math alttext="f prime of x equals, the sine of e raised to the fraction x over 4, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>â€²</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><mi>e</mi><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> on the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 5 comma 8, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. Of the following, which is the largest subinterval of <math alttext="open parenthesis, 5 comma 8, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> on which the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave up?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 5 comma 7.448, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>7.448</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
<math alttext="open parenthesis, 5 comma 8, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 6.201 comma 8, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>6.201</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 7.352 comma 8, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>7.352</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 6.201 comma 8, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>6.201</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
